channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: How Nicolas Maduro’s arrest turned Nike into a viral talking point
Who was Nikitha Godishala, Indian woman found murdered at her ex-boyfriend’s house in US?
How Venezuela’s Nicolas Maduro became a follower of Indian godman Sathya Sai Baba
Why has India banned use of power banks on flights?
Will employees get the right to disconnect in 2026?
What does Maduro’s capture mean for global oil prices? Will India be hit?
How Saudi-UAE fallout in Yemen raises fears of wider regional conflict
item.description: To allow any group to redraw borders through armed force and foreign patronage is to invite catastrophe at a critical connectivity chokepoint

item.title: US attack on Venezuela and capture of Maduro: America’s way is the highway
item.description: America First is no longer a slogan; it is a doctrine, but the ledger of force rarely balances neatly

item.title: How Saudi-UAE rivalry in Yemen could impact already fragile West Asia
item.description: In the context of Yemen, geography is both an asset and a liability, as its strategic location on the Bab el-Mandeb Strait offers control over critical maritime routes but also exposes it to regional conflicts and foreign interventions

item.title: India needs sharp pragmatism in Myanmar as elections set stage for Junta
item.description: After the elections, China will further expand its influence in Myanmar, which could affect India’s influence and regional security as well. India must have all its negotiating levers ready, even if it is through hard power

item.title: How Congress, Pentagon contain Potus overreach and how India should leverage it
item.description: Congress acts overtly through laws and funding, while the Pentagon uses threat assessments and signals. These serve as checks on presidential excesses and preserve strategic continuity, even if the White House moves toward ideological retrenchment

item.title: Bangladesh: How Yunus regime’s mobocracy has weaponised the persecution of minorities
item.description: By refusing to acknowledge the communal nature of the violence, the Yunus administration sent a clear signal: mobs would not be restrained
